item.title: A New palette() for R
item.description: In R, it is possible to specify a color in several ways: by name, col = "red"; by hex code, col = "#FF0000"; or by number, col = 2. The last of these, a numeric color specification, is a numeric index into a “color palette”, which is controlled via the palette() function. Without any arguments, this function returns the current set of palette colors; as we can see, the second color in the default palette is "red", so col = 2 corresponds to red.
